name: The Non Breaker
Kit ICE destruction v2
description: Changes from original version: Bumped up Gordian Blade to x3 to ensure getting it early. Removed 1 Escher and 1 Indexing, and added 1 Levy AR Lab Access.

name: Kitscher
description:
Attempting to make a Kit deck that capitalizes on Notoreity and Quest Completed. A minimum of breakers, with the hope that Test Run/Motivation + Eureka will get them into play, and Clone Chip will get them back when they're trashed. Escher just for fun, and Indexing because it can easy win an early game/R&D lock situation. Based originally off of a deck I found on Meteor.

I'm editing this out in the open, after publishing, because I'm not sure what I want this to be and figure if anyone has good comments, they can perhaps help me figure it out.

name: Boardroom Blitz (v1.1)
description:
3-0 at FFG's March monthly (7th out of 20+ players, 4-2 overall). I'll be sticking with this at least until Honor & Profit, including in at least one more Store Championship and another FFG monthly.

The only change from 1.0 is +2 Anonymous Tip, +2 Subliminal Messaging. With 3x Jackson and 2x Anonymous Tip, I was comfortable going from 40 cards to 44. I didn't have any trouble getting SanSans/Biotics.

2x Subliminal turned out to be a nice add. After scoring an Astro or Beale, the deck is often low on money. Subliminal is a nice way to net an extra credit here and there to keep me afloat. The other option would be 2x Restucture, but if I'm over 10 credits I'm almost always about to rez a SanSan or play at least one Biotic Labor.

Grim is clutch, but you have to time your rez properly. Sniping an Opus, which I did twice at the tourney, is huge.

I've never needed to take the full 15c from Profiteering. 10c seems to be the right answer almost every time.

When Guard comes out, I'll probably swap in 2x for a Wraparound and a Grim.

name: Sonic the Hedgehog (v0.1)
description:
First pass at an Express deck. 20 run events + Prepaid VoicePAD + Desperado + Datasucker should net some money.

Standard Anarch breakers plus emergency Crypsis and Femme.

Exploratory Romp is in there because I expect Mushin No Shin, Plan B, and Jinteki in general to be big when Honor and Profit comes out, and it neuters their open remotes for free.

I could see 3x Same Old Thing over 3x Prepaid VoicePAD.

name: bring me his head bbw
description: let the runner steal an agenda then murder them, plain and simple. Has worked very well on octgn

name: quickly now v4.0
description: fast advance, uses the identity as an extra turn so you can get started on getting out those agendas early. once they have their breaker suite up hopefully you can just start scoring the agenda's out of hand.

name: Kitscheriety
description: Attempting to make a Kit deck that capitalizes on Notoriety and Quest Completed (though I can only afford one with Kit's limited influence). A minimum of breakers, with the hope that Test Run/Motivation/Eureka will get them into play, and Clone Chip will get them back when they're trashed. Escher just for fun, and Indexing because it can easy win an early game/R&D lock situation.

name: Keyblade v1.1
description: A Kit deck I'm playtesting and tweaking for an upcoming local tournament. This will be my first time playing Netrunner in the competitive scene. As such, I'm looking for suggestions and advice to improve that deck and in general what to expect going in. As you can probably guess, this deck hits R&D fast and hard. The "key" component is Yog.0 (I know, I'm terrible :p) coupled with Dinosaurus which basically allows you to ignore just about any code gates you come across (and therefore) the first ICE encountered each turn. For everything else there's Atman, Knight, and Femme using whichever is best for the current situation.

name: Midknight Express V0.1
description: Basically tries to reinstill gabe's ability combined with Ken's, using knight to really make it tough to shut down the grifters once they're going. Multiaccess is wanted, something like legwork. I'm still fine tuning but I want to see how this feels to everyone else.

name: Sonic the Hedgehog (v0.2)
description:
Quick tweaks! Couldn't keep the VoicePADs in there while fitting in SOT and Plascrete. Still, 19 run events + Desperado + Datasucker should net some money.

Saved some influence by going to central-only breakers for , and spent it on Vamp for extra denial. Account Siphon, Vamp, Emergency Shutdown, and Running Interference should allow you to get into whatever server your speedy blue heart desires.

Room for Faeries and a Femme would be nice, but whoo boy is space ever tight!

name: Tennin's Backup Plan
description:
Use Mushin No Shin and Tennin's ID power to charge up Plan B's, holding Agendas in-hand (coupled with Shock!s and Snare!s, HQ and RnD should be very difficult to steal Agendas from). All Agendas in the deck require more than just access to steal. Interns and JHow recurs the Plan B's.

ToL as a backup if the Runner doesn't take the bait, with ArchMem and JHow to recur them if needed.

Given the only econ is GRNDL Refineries and Pop-Ups, I'm pretty sure this deck will crash and burn spectacularly :-)

name: First try Tenma.
description:
Dedicated breakers for centrals. A lot of run events. Wyrm,parasite,clone chip, inside job to attack remote servers or make centrals porous. Indexing and SOT for R&D digs.

What do you think?

name: First try Tenma.2
description:
Dedicated breakers for centrals. A lot of run events. Indexing, maker's eye, notoriety, quest completed and satellite uplink to score big points.

No drawing cards though. What do you think?

name: Double Shot Expresso
description: I don't need to run your remotes... I'll score whenever I want, thanks.

name: tag 1.6
I love R&D 1.1
That Gentleman is a Blackguard
description: Waste money all day.

name: Kit's New 'My Little Pony' Backpack
description:
Get to R&D and stay in R&D. Use the Knights to fallow the code gate at the tope of R&D. If they trash that ICE, to get rid of the Knight, so be it. I want you to do that. Use clone chips or test runs to get the Knights back then keep at it. you can really only make one run on R&D a turn with Kit's ability and should capitalize on that with interfaces and Maker's Eyes.

When all the desk goes thin in mid to late game Levy back up and stick the Knights on ICE and start Maker's again.

name: On the Case
description: A basic money-making, trace war. Might dip into tag punishers.
